definitions.definition: the action or process of flying through the air.
an act of flying; a journey made through the air or in space, especially a scheduled journey made by an airline.
the movement or trajectory of a projectile or ball through the air.
examples: trajectory, path through the air, track, orbit the flight of a baseball

definitions.definition: relating to or denoting archery in which the main concern is shooting long distances.

examples: the never-ending flight of future days

definitions.definition: a group of creatures or objects flying together, in particular.
a flock or large body of birds or insects in the air, especially when migrating.
a group of aircraft operating together, especially an air force unit of about six aircraft.
examples: a refueling mission in which his crew topped off three flights of four F-16A jets

definitions.definition: the action of fleeing or attempting to escape.
examples: refugees on the latest stage of their flight from turmoil

definitions.definition: a series of steps between floors or levels.
examples: she has to come up four flights of stairs to her apartment
synonyms: set of stairs "a flight of stairs"

definitions.definition: a series of hurdles across a racetrack.
a closely spaced sequence of locks in a canal.
an extravagant or far-fetched idea or account.
examples: ignoring such ridiculous flights of fancy

definitions.definition: (in soccer, cricket, etc.) deliver (a ball) with well-judged trajectory and pace.
examples: he flighted a free kick into the box
